result.execSummary:
The defendant Claud M Loughran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Claud M Loughran

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from 16th Street Community Health Center
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Claud M Loughran in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended criminal complaint.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended criminal complaint.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended criminal complaint.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendaat to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $284.50 - to be paid by performing community service at rate of $10.00 per hour (to be completed within 6 months), alternate 6 days jail if not completed

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**

Defendant Claud M Loughran in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment as she is still negotiating with the state.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Claud M Loughran in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment as she is still waiting for some verification from Defendant regarding counseling.     Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
to appear filed by Attorney Eryn Menden

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Claud M Loughran did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment, stating that there was a misunderstanding with Defendant as to court date.  State has offer to amend with completion of counseling.  Court adjourns.     Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Claud M Loughran in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden reqeusts an adjourned date as she has been having difficulty contacting charging attorney. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Claud M Loughran in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Claud M Loughran in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
